info.description:
API definition for PDS

 | API Documentation |
 |-----|
  |[Personal Demographics Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/personal-demographics-service-fhir)|


 | FHIR Implementation Guide | Version |
 |-----|-----|
 |[ukcore.release1.test](https://simplifier.net/guide/hl7fhirukcorer4release1/home)||
 |[uk.nhsdigital.r4.test](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home)||

tags.name: Patient
tags.description:
Demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

 Tracking patient is the center of the healthcare process.

 Profile (constraints): [NHSDigital-Patient](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/Profiles/NHSDigital-Patient.guide.md)



 ### identifier

At least one patient identifier, **MUST** be provided. Where a traced NHS number is available for a patient this MUST be included. 

Local identiers such as MRN **MUST** include a *system* which identifies NHS provider/assigning authority.

tags.name: RelatedPerson
tags.description:
Information about a person that is involved in the care for a patient, but who is not the target of healthcare, nor has a formal responsibility in the care process.

 Need to track persons related to the patient or the healthcare process.

 Profile (constraints): [UKCore-RelatedPerson](https://simplifier.net/guide/HL7FHIRUKCoreR4Release1/Home/ProfilesandExtensions/ProfileUKCore-RelatedPerson)



 Defines the UK Core constraints and extensions on the RelatedPerson resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve related person information.

 This profile allows exchange of information about a person that is involved in the care for an individual, but who is not the target of healthcare, nor has a formal responsibility in the care process.

parameters.description: The resource ID

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
An [OAuth 2.0 bearer token](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/guides-and-documentation/security-and-authorisation#user-restricted-apis).

Required in all environments except sandbox.

parameters.name: NHSD-Session-URID
parameters.description: The user role ID (URID) for the current session. Also known as a user role profile ID (URPID).

parameters.name: X-Request-ID
parameters.description: A globally unique identifier (GUID) for the request, which we use to de-duplicate repeated requests and to trace the request if you contact our helpdesk

parameters.name: X-Correlation-ID
parameters.description: An optional ID which you can use to track transactions across multiple systems. It can have any value, but we recommend avoiding `.` characters.

The patient's family name (surname).

 | Name | Type |  Expression | 
 |--------|--------|--------| 
 | family | [string ](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/search.html#string)|  Patient.name.family |

parameters.description:
A portion of the given name of the patient

 | Name | Type |  Expression |

 | given | [string ](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/search.html#string)|  Patient.name.given |

parameters.description:
Gender of the patient

 | Name | Type |  Expression |

parameters.description:
The patient's date of birth

parameters.description:
The date of death has been provided and satisfies this search value

 | Name | Type |  Expression |

parameters.description:
A postalCode specified in an address

 | Name | Type |  Expression | 
 |--------|--------|--------| 
 

 Caution: This does not appear to be a valid search parameter. **Please check HL7 FHIR conformance.**

CapabilityStatement.description: HL7 FHIR Schema [CapabilityStatement](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/fhir.schema.json#/definitions/CapabilityStatement).. HL7 FHIR Documentation [CapabilityStatement]("https://www.hl7.org/fhir/CapabilityStatement.html")

OperationOutcome.description: HL7 FHIR Schema [OperationOutcome](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/fhir.schema.json#/definitions/OperationOutcome).. HL7 FHIR Documentation [OperationOutcome]("https://www.hl7.org/fhir/OperationOutcome.html")

identifier.description:
`mustSupport`
 `max = *`

 [Identifier](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 


 An identifier for this patient

 At least one patient identifier, common to both sender and receiver. Where a traced NHS number is available for a patient this MUST be included in the list.

identifier:nhsNumber.description:
`mustSupport`
 `max = 1`

 [Identifier](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 


 The patient's NHS number

 An identifier for this patient.

system.description:
`mustSupport`
 `max = 1`
 `fixed value = https://fhir.nhs.uk/Id/nhs-number`

 [uri](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 


 The namespace for the identifier value

 Establishes the namespace for the value - that is, a URL that describes a set values that are unique.

value.description:
`max = 1`

 [string](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 


 The value that is unique

 The portion of the identifier typically relevant to the user and which is unique within the context of the system.

name.description:
`mustSupport`
 `max = *`

 [HumanName](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 


 A name associated with the patient

 A name associated with the individual.

family.description:
`mustSupport`
 `max = 1`

 [string](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 


 Family name (often called 'Surname')

 The part of a name that links to the genealogy. In some cultures (e.g. Eritrea) the family name of a son is the first name of his father.

given.description:
`mustSupport`
 `max = 5`

 [string](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 


 Given names (not always 'first'). Includes middle names

 Given name.

telecom.description:
`mustSupport`
 `max = *`

 [ContactPoint](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 


 A contact detail for the individual

 A contact detail (e.g. a telephone number or an email address) by which the individual may be contacted.

gender.description:
`max = 1`

 [code](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 


 male | female | other | unknown

 Administrative Gender - the gender that the patient is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.
 `Required` [http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/administrative-gender|4.0.1](https://simplifier.net/search?canonical=http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/administrative-gender|4.0.1)The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

birthDate.description:
`mustSupport`
 `max = 1`

 [date](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 


 The date of birth for the individual

 The date of birth for the individual.

address.description:
`mustSupport`
 `max = *`

 [Address](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 


 An address for the individual

 An address for the individual

contact.description:
`max = *`

system.description:
`max = 1`

 [uri](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 


 The namespace for the identifier value

 Establishes the namespace for the value - that is, a URL that describes a set values that are unique.

value.description:
`max = 1`

 [string](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 


 The value that is unique

 The portion of the identifier typically relevant to the user and which is unique within the context of the system.

identifier.description:
`max = 1`

 [Identifier](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 


 Logical reference, when literal reference is not known

 An identifier for the target resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity it represents is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.

 Patient's nominated primary care provider

 Patient's registered GP Practice. Use V81998 for no registered practice and V81999 for not known as per NHS Data Dictionary guidelines.

Patient.description:
HL7 FHIR Schema [Patient](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/fhir.schema.json#/definitions/Patient).. HL7 FHIR Documentation [Patient]("https://www.hl7.org/fhir/Patient.html")

 ### identifier

At least one patient identifier, **MUST** be provided. Where a traced NHS number is available for a patient this MUST be included. 

Local identiers such as MRN **MUST** include a *system* which identifies NHS provider/assigning authority.

patient.description:
`max = 1`

 [Reference](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html) 

 - [https://fhir.hl7.org.uk/StructureDefinition/UKCore-Patient](https://simplifier.net/search?canonical=https://fhir.hl7.org.uk/StructureDefinition/UKCore-Patient)

 The patient this person is related to

 The patient this person is related to.

RelatedPerson.description:
HL7 FHIR Schema [RelatedPerson](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/fhir.schema.json#/definitions/RelatedPerson).. HL7 FHIR Documentation [RelatedPerson]("https://www.hl7.org/fhir/RelatedPerson.html")

 Defines the UK Core constraints and extensions on the RelatedPerson resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve related person information.

 This profile allows exchange of information about a person that is involved in the care for an individual, but who is not the target of healthcare, nor has a formal responsibility in the care process.
